info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 1:41PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Lake and eastern Sanders Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 141 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ravalli, or 27 miles north of Missoula, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ravalli, St. Ignatius, Old Agency, Arlee, Dixon, Allentown, Moiese, Kicking Horse, Charlo and Fort Connah. This includes the following highways... Highway 93 N between mile markers 18 and 44. Highway 200 W between mile markers 108 and 115. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
